title: Here’s what to know about the HHS demand that Mass. erase ‘gender ideology’ from sex ed materials
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: The Trump administration ordered Massachusetts to remove 'gender ideology' from sex ed materials, risking $2.36 million in federal funding.
HHS warned Massachusetts and 45 other states to comply within 60 days or face cuts from the Personal Responsibility Education Program.
Production timeline and who’s attached are inside.

title: Filipa Patão shared her thoughts on becoming the inaugural head coach of Boston Legacy FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Filipa Patão is appointed as the inaugural head coach of Boston Legacy FC, transitioning from her role at Benfica.
Patão aims to integrate her strong foundational values with Boston’s, in alignment with GM Domènec Guasch, planning for the 2026 NWSL season.
What happens next is laid out inside.

title: Jeremy Swayman feels like a ‘completely different human being’ a year removed from contract dispute
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman signed an eight-year, $66 million contract with the Bruins after a contentious dispute last season.
Swayman feels rejuvenated with no contract issues and aims to improve his performance for the 2025-26 NHL season.
What happens next is laid out inside.

title: What Josh McDaniels said about facing the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Josh McDaniels, Patriots offensive coordinator, will face his former team, the Raiders, in Sunday's home opener in Foxborough.
McDaniels, fired after a 9-16 Raiders record, praises Raiders' coach Pete Carroll and aims for growth from past experiences.
What happens next is laid out inside.

title: Elizabeth Banks cast as Karen Read: What readers said about the limited series role
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Elizabeth Banks will star and executive produce a Prime Video series about Karen Read, sparking mixed reactions from Boston.com readers.
The series will explore themes of true crime fascination and institutional trust, with Read disapproving of the production.
What happens next is laid out inside.

title: 2 New England casinos just ranked the best in the U.S. (that aren’t in Las Vegas)
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Mohegan Sun in Uncasville and Foxwoods in Mashantucket ranked No. 2 and No. 3 in USA Today's top non-Vegas casinos list.
USA Today credited both casinos with expansive gaming options and exceptional guest experiences, part of its 2025 10Best Readers’ Choice Awards.
What happens next is laid out inside.

title: What to know about Seisiún, the two-day Irish music festival coming to Boston
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: The Seisiún music festival in Boston features headliners Dropkick Murphys and The Pogues at Suffolk Downs on September 6-7, 2025.
Tickets range from $75 to $403, with limited parking; public transit is recommended for the Suffolk Downs venue.
What happens next is laid out inside.

title: CommonWealth Kitchen staff, members speak out over toxic nonprofit: Globe report
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: CommonWealth Kitchen members and staff accused leadership of fostering a toxic workplace and failing to provide promised support.
Board supports Faigel amid criticisms, acknowledges challenges, and pledges to address concerns to improve organization and maintain its mission.
What happens next is laid out inside.

title: 44 proposed Mass. ballot questions, including rent control, move to next step — and 3 don’t make the cut
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: 44 proposed Massachusetts ballot questions, including rent control, advance; three proposals didn't meet requirements, according to AG Andrea Campbell.
Proponents of the 44 initiatives must collect 74,574 signatures by Dec. 3 to potentially appear on the 2026 and 2028 ballots.
What happens next is laid out inside.

title: RFK Jr. tries to defend COVID vaccine stance in raucous Senate hearing
author: The Associated Press
bullets: RFK Jr. defended his controversial COVID-19 vaccine stances in a heated Senate hearing questioned by both parties.
Medical groups and Democrats called for RFK Jr.'s resignation due to his anti-vaccine rhetoric and CDC leadership changes.
What happens next is laid out inside.
